item.title: Mari add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "Accept whatever comes to you woven in the pattern of your destiny, for what could more aptly fit your needs?" -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Mari add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "For God did not give us a spirit of timidity, but of power and of love and of calm and well balanced mind and discipline and self-control." -- Anonymous

item.title: Mari add a quote by Dryden
item.description: "Let Fortune empty her whole quiver on me, I have a soul that, like an ample shield, Can take in all, and verge enough for more; Fate was not mine, nor am I Fate's: Souls know no conquerors." -- Dryden

item.title: Mari add a quote by Samuel Butler
item.description: "All animals except man know that the principal business of life is to enjoy it." -- Samuel Butler

item.title: Mari add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The dog is a gentleman; I hope to go to his heaven not man's." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mari add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "Dogs never bite me. Just humans." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Mari add a quote by Max Depree
item.description: "We are alone, absolutely alone on this chance planet; and amid all the forms of life that surround us, not one, excepting the dog has made an alliance with us." -- Max Depree

item.title: Mari add a quote by Woodrow Wilson
item.description: "If a dog will not come to you after having looked you in the face, you should go home and examine your conscience." -- Woodrow Wilson

item.title: Mari add a quote by Roger Caras
item.description: "If you don't own a dog, at least one, there is not necessarily anything wrong with you, but there may be something wrong with your life." -- Roger Caras

item.title: Mari add a quote by James Thurber
item.description: "The dog has seldom been successful in pulling man up to its level of sagacity, but man has frequently dragged the dog down to his." -- James Thurber

item.title: Mari add a quote by Samuel Butler
item.description: "Life is like playing the violin in public and learning the instrument as one goes on." -- Samuel Butler

item.title: Mari add a quote by Samuel Butler
item.description: "The oldest books are still only just out to those who have not read them." -- Samuel Butler

item.title: Mari add a quote by Samuel Butler
item.description: "Man is the only animal that can remain on friendly terms with the victims he intends to eat until he eats them." -- Samuel Butler

item.title: Mari add a quote by Robert G. LeTourneau
item.description: "In my hour of greatest distress, I found my greatest asset in the form of a new partner. I took this partner into business with me. I did the muscle work and my partner told me how to do it. His name is God. " -- Robert G. LeTourneau
